conclusion: Determine the output power of the power source when connected to the resistor using P = I * V.
The intersection point of the two lines represents the operating point of the power source when connected to the resistor.
The intersection point is at I = 2 A and V = 2 V.
The current I is the x-coordinate of the intersection point, which is 2 A.
The voltage V is the y-coordinate of the intersection point, which is 2 V.
Calculate the output power P using P = I * V, resulting in P = 2 A * 2 V = 4 W.
The output power of the power source is 4 W.
